with ENS on Sepolia (0x57f1887a8BF19b14fC0dF6Fd9B2acc9Af147eA85)  Flow: 1. Bob approves this contract for his ENS NFT 2. Bob calls stakeENS(tokenId) - ENS is transferred to this contract 3. Alice vouches for Bob through the Backr system 4. Bob borrows and must repay within deadline 5. If Bob repays: he can call unstakeENS() to get his ENS back 6. If Bob defaults: anyone can call slashENS() to burn his ENS reputation","kind":"dev","methods":{"clearDefault(address)":{"params":{"user":"The address that repaid"}},"markDefault(address)":{"details":"Called by Backr backend when debt is overdue","params":{"user":"The address that defaulted"}},"slashENS(address)":{"details":"Anyone can call this after the grace periodThis is the \"Social Nuke\" - markDefault(address).details: Called by Backr backend when debt is overdue

slashENS(address).details: Anyone can call this after the grace periodThis is the "Social Nuke" - permanent reputation damage

stakeENS(uint256).details: User must approve this contract first: ENS_REGISTRAR.approve(address(this), tokenId)

params.tokenId: The ENS token ID (labelhash of your .eth name)

unstakeENS().details: Only works if you haven't defaulted

GRACE_PERIOD().notice: Grace period after default before ENS can be slashed (7 days)

backrOracle().notice: Backend/Oracle address that can mark defaults

canBeSlashed(address).notice: Check if a user's ENS can be slashed

clearDefault(address).notice: Clear a user's default status (they repaid)

hasStakedENS(address).notice: Check if a user has staked ENS

isInDefault(address).notice: Check if a user is in default

markDefault(address).notice: Mark a user as defaulted on their debt

slashENS(address).notice: Slash a defaulter's ENS - sends it to burn address

stakedENS(address).notice: Mapping from user address to their staked ENS

timeUntilSlashable(address).notice: Get time remaining before ENS can be slashed

tokenToStaker(uint256).notice: Mapping from tokenId to staker address (for reverse lookup)

unstakeENS().notice: Unstake your ENS and get it back
